Council for Sustainable Development and Social Responsibility

The Council for Sustainable Development and Social Responsibility (CSS Mongolia) is a non-profit, non-governmental organization that serves the society established in 2015 by the initiative of specialists of Mongolian leading mining companies, sustainable development, environment, community relations, social responsibility and public relations and with the aim of introducing and advancing best international and local practices in sustainable development and corporate social responsibility into the country’s mining sector.

Vision

Creating shared value for sustainable development

Mission

To develop and disseminate best practices in social, economic, environmental, and governance sectors.

Values

  • Sustainable Development
  • Creative Solutions
  • Mutual Respect
  • Diverse Partnerships

Board of Directors

Otgonbayar Batbold

Co-Founder, Chairperson of the Board

Since January 2019, Batbold O. has served as Chair of the Board of the Council for Sustainable Development and Social Responsibility (CSS) of Mongolia. He has over 14 years of extensive experience leading research teams and managing community relations and multi-stakeholder communications in the mining sector, both in Mongolia and internationally. In 2020, he began his Ph.D. studies at Speyer University in Germany, where he is conducting doctoral research on “Mining and Communities – Community Development Agreements.”

OTGONTUYA GONGOR

Co-Founder, Vice Chairperson of the Board

G. Otgontuya graduated from the National University of Mongolia with a bachelor's degree in Journalism and the Institute of Finance and Economics of Mongolia with a master's degree in Business Administration. From 2001 to 2012, she worked as the Head of the Information and Dissemination Program at the Mongolian Red Cross Society and a Specialist in the Microinsurance Project at the UNDP in Mongolia. From 2012 to 2024, while working as a Social Responsibility and Public Relations Manager at Energy Resources (Mongolian Mining Corporation), she successfully implemented numerous projects and programs aimed at implementing responsible mining principles, introducing international standards, and strengthening local relations and stakeholder engagement.

BATKHUU Tserenbyambaa

Member of the Board

A professional with over 20 years of experience in government, the United Nations, and the mining sector, specializing in foreign policy and sustainable development. Holds a Bachelor’s and Master’s degree in International Relations from universities in Mongolia and Japan, and is an expert in Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), leadership, and management. Served as Foreign Policy Officer at the President’s Office of Mongolia, Head of Foreign Relations and Cooperation at Ulaanbaatar City, Project Manager for SME development at UNDP, and spent 14 years with the Australian mining group Thiess Mongolia as Manager for Government and Community Relations managing local investment and development. Currently serves as Director of Sustainable Development at Khurgatai Khairkhan LLC. Enjoys traveling, reading, and running, with advanced proficiency in Russian and English, and working knowledge of Korean and Japanese.

Executive Team

The Executive Team includes research analysts, experienced journalists specializing in mining and economics, communication specialists, web designers and content developers. CSS also cooperates with research institutions, governmental and non-governmental organizations.

Nominkhuu Ariuntuya

Executive Director

N. Ariuntuya is a seasoned journalist and media professional specializing in mining and economy. Since 2019, she has served as Executive Director of the Council for Sustainable Development and Social Responsibility NGO, leading initiatives on vocational education, research, and monitoring in the mining sector. In 2021, she co-founded Mining Insight magazine, where she continues to serve as CEO and Editor-in-Chief.

BOLORTUVSHIN Altangerel

Bolortuvshin A. has been serving as the Financial Officer of the CSS since August 2024. With a background in accounting and auditing, he has eight years of professional experience in the field. She graduated from Mandakh Accounting University in 2017 with a bachelor’s degree in “Accounting and Audit”. From 2017 to 2019, she worked as an Asset and Expense Accountant and later as a Senior Accountant at the Finance and Accounting Department of “Minii Delguur” Company. From 2020 to 2024, she served as the Chief Accountant at the Finance, Administration, and Human Resources Department of “Khalkh Mongol Holdings.”

UUGANBAYAR Damdinsuren

Uuganbayar D. has been serving as the manager at Umnugovi of the CSS since January 2022. Graduated in 2017 from the School of International Relations and Public Administration at the National University of Mongolia with a degree in Management &amp; Public Administration. Completed advanced training at the Academy of Management on “Internal Affairs and Coordination of Local Administrative Organizations” and “Development Policy, Planning, Implementation, and Evaluation of Mongolia.” Obtained a Master’s degree in Public Management from Royal International University in 2024. Certified Lead Auditor under the ISO 9001:2015 Quality Management System.
